meanings.definition: The quality or state of being raw.
meanings.sent1: The rawness of the vegetables gave them a natural taste.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the rawness of the emotion in her voice.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking showed a certain rawness in his skills.
meanings.sent4: The rawness of the situation left everyone feeling vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The rawness of the wound made it difficult to touch.

meanings.definition: The state of being unprocessed or unrefined.
meanings.sent1: The rawness of the data made it hard to analyze.
meanings.sent2: The rawness of the wood gave the furniture a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: Her painting captured the rawness of nature beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The rawness of the material added character to the design.
meanings.sent5: The rawness of the fabric made it feel rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: The lack of experience or sophistication.
meanings.sent1: His rawness in negotiations was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The rawness of her performance showed her potential for growth.
meanings.sent3: Despite his rawness, he approached the task with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The rawness of his skills was overshadowed by his passion.
meanings.sent5: The rawness of the team was balanced by their eagerness to learn.
